Introduction.description: The Clean Air Green Corridor (CAGC) is a youth-led initiative that has been actively working since 2017 to transform 182nd Street, stretching from Broadway to High Bridge Park, into a vibrant and sustainable space. This project focuses on enhancing the environmental quality of the area by engaging young people in efforts to promote cleaner air, greener streets, and healthier communities. Through their ongoing work, the CAGC aims to create a more livable urban environment that benefits both residents and visitors alike.

Our Mission.Improve Air Quality: by reducing pollutionin densely populated urban areas.

Our Mission.Creating green spaces: to enhance the environment and provide areas for community engagement.

Our Mission.Empowering youth: to take leadership roles in environmental activism and urban transformation.

Our Mission.Encouraging sustainable transportation: such as walking and biking, to reduce carbon emissions.

Our Mission.Educating residents: on the benefits of eco-friendly urban development and sustainable practices.

Get Involved: Be part of the change! Volunteer in tree planting, clean-ups, or educational events to help transform our community. Donate to support youth programs and green projects that enhance air quality. Partner with us if you're a local business or organization to create sustainable initiatives together. Spread the word on social media to raise awareness. Together, we can build a cleaner and greener neighborhood.
